questionText: Do you allow employees to use personal devices to access business data?
relatedRisk: Unmanaged devices may introduce malware or lead to data leaks

questionText: Do all employees have unique usernames and passwords?
relatedRisk: Shared credentials reduce accountability and increase insider threats

questionText: Do you regularly back up your business-critical data?
relatedRisk: Data loss due to ransomware or system failure

questionText: Do you have a list of all third-party vendors who access your systems or data?
relatedRisk: Unknown third parties can introduce hidden vulnerabilities

questionText: Have you trained employees on recognizing phishing or scam emails?
relatedRisk: Human error is a leading cause of security incidents

questionText: Do you require strong passwords or multi-factor authentication (MFA)?
relatedRisk: Weak authentication increases the chance of unauthorized access

questionText: Do you control who can physically access your office or server areas?
relatedRisk: Unauthorized visitors may steal or tamper with devices

questionText: Do you scan your systems for viruses or malware on a regular basis?
relatedRisk: Infections can cause downtime or spread to customers

questionText: Do you have a formal plan for what to do during a cyberattack or data breach?
relatedRisk: Lack of preparedness prolongs recovery and increases damage

questionText: Do you keep track of who logs into your systems and when?
relatedRisk: Lack of visibility makes it hard to detect malicious activity

questionText: Do you regularly review user access rights to ensure only the right people have access?
relatedRisk: Former employees or misconfigured accounts may retain access

questionText: Do you classify and label your business data based on sensitivity?
relatedRisk: Unlabeled data may be improperly shared or exposed

questionText: Do you require employees to sign confidentiality or acceptable use agreements?
relatedRisk: Without policy enforcement, risky behaviors may go unchecked

questionText: Do you test your ability to recover from a system failure or ransomware event?
relatedRisk: Recovery may fail or take longer than expected without testing

questionText: Do you encrypt sensitive customer or financial data at rest and in transit?
relatedRisk: Unencrypted data may be intercepted or stolen

questionText: Have you documented which systems and data are most critical to your operations?
relatedRisk: Without prioritization, recovery efforts may be misdirected

questionText: Do you review and patch software vulnerabilities regularly?
relatedRisk: Exploited vulnerabilities can lead to remote system takeover

questionText: Do you restrict admin rights to only those who truly need them?
relatedRisk: Admin accounts are high-value targets

questionText: Do you log and review system activity for unusual behavior?
relatedRisk: Anomalies can go unnoticed without proper monitoring

questionText: Do you have an internal point person responsible for cybersecurity?
relatedRisk: Without ownership, issues may go unaddressed

questionText: Do you provide security awareness training for all new employees as part of onboarding?
relatedRisk: New hires may unintentionally create vulnerabilities without basic security knowledge

questionText: Do you evaluate the security practices of third-party vendors before sharing data with them?
relatedRisk: Third parties may mishandle or lose sensitive information

questionText: Do you regularly test your data backups to ensure they can be restored correctly?
relatedRisk: Backups may fail when needed, leading to data loss

questionText: Do you have a documented process for reporting security incidents internally?
relatedRisk: Employees may not know how or when to report incidents

questionText: Do you use any automated tools to detect unusual activity on your network or systems?
relatedRisk: Suspicious behavior may go unnoticed without real-time monitoring

questionText: Do you restrict file sharing and cloud storage to approved platforms only?
relatedRisk: Unauthorized cloud apps may expose data to external threats

questionText: Have you formally assigned roles and responsibilities for information security within your organization?
relatedRisk: Lack of clear accountability may lead to oversight or delays in response

questionText: Do you keep an inventory of all computers, servers, and network devices your business uses?
relatedRisk: Untracked assets may go unpatched or fall outside protection scope

questionText: Do you log changes to configurations or software in production systems?
relatedRisk: Unauthorized or accidental changes may go undetected

questionText: Do you subscribe to any services or feeds to stay informed of new security threats?
relatedRisk: Outdated threat intelligence can delay critical protections

questionText: Do you log and review who accesses restricted physical areas of your business? #1
relatedRisk: Physical spaces without audit logs can allow undetected access.

questionText: Do you enforce session timeouts or automatic logouts after periods of inactivity? #2
relatedRisk: Sessions left open can be exploited for unauthorized access.

questionText: Have you conducted a tabletop exercise to simulate a security breach scenario? #3
relatedRisk: Teams may not be prepared to handle real-world incidents.

questionText: Do you have documented policies for acceptable use of company devices and systems? #4
relatedRisk: Employees may misuse company systems without clear rules.

questionText: Does management regularly review your cybersecurity policies and practices? #5
relatedRisk: Lack of oversight may lead to outdated or missing policies.

questionText: Do you track which systems are up-to-date with the latest security patches? #6
relatedRisk: Unpatched systems are a common entry point for attackers.

questionText: Do you test employee awareness with simulated phishing campaigns? #7
relatedRisk: Employees may fall for phishing attempts without training.

questionText: Do you tag or label critical assets to ensure traceability? #8
relatedRisk: Untagged assets may go unmonitored or unprotected.

questionText: Do you alert system admins automatically when suspicious activity is detected? #9
relatedRisk: Missed alerts may allow threats to go undetected.

questionText: Do you use encryption for emails containing sensitive information? #10
relatedRisk: Unencrypted communication could be intercepted.

questionText: Do you log and review who accesses restricted physical areas of your business? #11
relatedRisk: Unauthorized physical access can lead to equipment theft or tampering.

questionText: Do you enforce session timeouts or automatic logouts after periods of inactivity? #12
relatedRisk: Unauthorized access to facilities could compromise physical assets.

questionText: Have you conducted a tabletop exercise to simulate a security breach scenario? #13
relatedRisk: Without regular updates, antivirus may miss new threats.

questionText: Do you have documented policies for acceptable use of company devices and systems? #14
relatedRisk: Lack of a response plan can lead to confusion during crises.

questionText: Does management regularly review your cybersecurity policies and practices? #15
relatedRisk: Failure to log activity makes it hard to trace security events.

questionText: Do you track which systems are up-to-date with the latest security patches? #16
relatedRisk: Old or excessive permissions create security blind spots.

questionText: Do you test employee awareness with simulated phishing campaigns? #17
relatedRisk: Unlabeled data may be overshared or misused.

questionText: Do you tag or label critical assets to ensure traceability? #18
relatedRisk: No formal agreements increase the chance of misuse or leaks.

questionText: Do you alert system admins automatically when suspicious activity is detected? #19
relatedRisk: Recovery testing ensures backups are functional and current.

questionText: Do you use encryption for emails containing sensitive information? #20
relatedRisk: Unencrypted data can be intercepted or leaked.

questionText: Do you log and review who accesses restricted physical areas of your business? #21
relatedRisk: Lack of asset prioritization can delay disaster recovery.

questionText: Do you enforce session timeouts or automatic logouts after periods of inactivity? #22
relatedRisk: Unpatched software can be exploited by attackers.

questionText: Have you conducted a tabletop exercise to simulate a security breach scenario? #23
relatedRisk: Overprivileged accounts present high-risk targets.

questionText: Do you have documented policies for acceptable use of company devices and systems? #24
relatedRisk: Unmonitored systems can hide signs of compromise.

questionText: Does management regularly review your cybersecurity policies and practices? #25
relatedRisk: No one managing cybersecurity can leave threats unaddressed.

questionText: Do you track which systems are up-to-date with the latest security patches? #26
relatedRisk: Unpatched systems may expose the organization to known threats.

questionText: Do you test employee awareness with simulated phishing campaigns? #27
relatedRisk: Employees unaware of phishing threats are more likely to be tricked.

questionText: Do you tag or label critical assets to ensure traceability? #28
relatedRisk: Lack of asset tagging may lead to unmanaged devices and shadow IT.

questionText: Do you alert system admins automatically when suspicious activity is detected? #29
relatedRisk: Without alerts, administrators may miss security incidents.

questionText: Do you use encryption for emails containing sensitive information? #30
relatedRisk: Unencrypted communications can be intercepted or manipulated.

questionText: Do you log and review who accesses restricted physical areas of your business? #31
relatedRisk: Insufficient logging makes it difficult to identify unauthorized access.

questionText: Do you enforce session timeouts or automatic logouts after periods of inactivity? #32
relatedRisk: Sessions left active increase the chance of unauthorized access.

questionText: Have you conducted a tabletop exercise to simulate a security breach scenario? #33
relatedRisk: Without practice, teams may be unprepared to respond to real incidents.

questionText: Do you have documented policies for acceptable use of company devices and systems? #34
relatedRisk: No acceptable use policy may lead to risky behavior by staff.

questionText: Does management regularly review your cybersecurity policies and practices? #35
relatedRisk: No oversight on cybersecurity practices increases organizational risk.

questionText: Do you track which systems are up-to-date with the latest security patches? #36
relatedRisk: Outdated software increases vulnerability to known exploits.

questionText: Do you test employee awareness with simulated phishing campaigns? #37
relatedRisk: Repeated phishing tests help gauge and improve staff resilience.

questionText: Do you tag or label critical assets to ensure traceability? #38
relatedRisk: Lack of labeling may cause mishandling of sensitive assets.

questionText: Do you alert system admins automatically when suspicious activity is detected? #39
relatedRisk: Critical alerts help identify abnormal behavior in real time.

questionText: Do you use encryption for emails containing sensitive information? #40
relatedRisk: Email encryption helps prevent unauthorized reading of content.

questionText: Do you log and review who accesses restricted physical areas of your business? #41
relatedRisk: Failure to audit physical access can lead to undetected breaches.

questionText: Do you enforce session timeouts or automatic logouts after periods of inactivity? #42
relatedRisk: Sessions that don't auto-terminate pose security risk.

questionText: Have you conducted a tabletop exercise to simulate a security breach scenario? #43
relatedRisk: Simulation exercises reveal gaps in response capabilities.

questionText: Do you have documented policies for acceptable use of company devices and systems? #44
relatedRisk: No acceptable use policy can lead to misuse of IT systems.

questionText: Does management regularly review your cybersecurity policies and practices? #45
relatedRisk: Without leadership review, security gaps may go unaddressed.

questionText: Do you track which systems are up-to-date with the latest security patches? #46
relatedRisk: Outdated systems may contain exploitable vulnerabilities.

questionText: Do you test employee awareness with simulated phishing campaigns? #47
relatedRisk: Untrained staff may fall for phishing or social engineering.

questionText: Do you tag or label critical assets to ensure traceability? #48
relatedRisk: Unlabeled or untracked assets may bypass security controls.

questionText: Do you alert system admins automatically when suspicious activity is detected? #49
relatedRisk: Without real-time alerts, threats may go undetected.

questionText: Do you use encryption for emails containing sensitive information? #50
relatedRisk: Emails with sensitive data may be intercepted if not encrypted.

questionText: Do you have a policy that defines how your company manages cybersecurity risks?
relatedRisk: Absence of formal governance over security practices
possibleImpacts: Compliance failure, operational chaos, audit delays

questionText: Have you identified the main cybersecurity threats your business might face, like phishing, data loss, or ransomware?
relatedRisk: Unidentified threats lead to unprepared defenses
possibleImpacts: Data breach, financial fraud, business interruption

questionText: Do you consider how cyber risks could impact your business partners or customers?
relatedRisk: Overlooking downstream or supply chain impacts
possibleImpacts: Contract breaches, client losses, legal risk

questionText: Do you regularly test whether your backups work and can be restored?
relatedRisk: Backups may be useless if they don’t work in an emergency
possibleImpacts: Permanent data loss, extended downtime, loss of customer trust

questionText: Do you have a reliable way to detect if sensitive data is being accessed or copied without permission?
relatedRisk: Undetected data theft or insider access
possibleImpacts: Regulatory fines, customer loss, reputational damage

questionText: If something suspicious happens, like unusual logins or system errors, do you investigate it to understand what went wrong?
relatedRisk: Ignored warning signs could signal an attack
possibleImpacts: Ongoing breach, customer harm, legal claims

questionText: After a security incident, do you make changes to prevent the same thing from happening again?
relatedRisk: Repeat vulnerabilities due to lack of follow-up
possibleImpacts: Recurring threats, financial loss, compliance failure

questionText: Do you have a basic recovery plan to help your business bounce back after a cyberattack or IT failure?
relatedRisk: No recovery structure leads to prolonged disruption
possibleImpacts: Missed contracts, staff downtime, revenue loss

questionText: Do you have a way to get in touch with law enforcement or a legal advisor if your business is targeted in a cybercrime?
relatedRisk: Missed legal obligations or delayed response
possibleImpacts: Fines, investigation delays, escalation of threat

questionText: Do you make sure only approved software is installed on your company devices?
relatedRisk: Uncontrolled installations can introduce malware or data leakage
possibleImpacts: System compromise, lost data, compliance issues

questionText: Are your security policies reviewed at least once a year or when things change in your business?
relatedRisk: Outdated rules don’t match current threats
possibleImpacts: Policy gaps, audit findings, poor response readiness

questionText: Do you check if your business is following relevant laws and regulations that apply to data privacy or cybersecurity?
relatedRisk: Noncompliance with industry rules or regulations

questionText: Are your business documents, software, and brand assets protected from theft or misuse by others?
relatedRisk: Intellectual property may be stolen or misused
possibleImpacts: Competitive loss, legal disputes, revenue impact

questionText: After an incident, do you document what happened and what you did about it?
relatedRisk: Lack of documentation limits learning and compliance evidence
possibleImpacts: Repeat mistakes, audit failures, insurer disputes

questionText: Do you decide how to prioritize cybersecurity risks based on how likely and severe they are?
relatedRisk: Treating all risks equally wastes time and leaves big threats unresolved
possibleImpacts: Misallocated resources, poor response readiness, strategic failure

questionText: Do you make risk-based decisions when prioritizing projects or allocating resources?
relatedRisk: Lack of alignment between business priorities and risk exposure

questionText: Do you have automated alerts or thresholds to detect unusual system behavior or possible attacks?
relatedRisk: Delayed detection of incidents increases damage and response time

questionText: After a security incident, do you conduct a formal review to identify lessons learned and adjust your response plan?
relatedRisk: Repeating the same mistakes due to lack of continuous improvement
